node.title: Belarus jails opposition leader's husband for 18 years in 'revenge' verdict
node.alt: A woman holds a picture of husband at a protest.
node.description: A Belarusian court hands the opposition leader's husband, Syarhei Tsikhanouski, one of the longest jail terms in the nation's modern history after a court finds him guilty of organising mass unrest and of inciting social hatred.
node.content:
["A court in Belarus has sentenced the opposition leader's husband\u00a0to 18 years in jail after he was arrested during an attempt to run for president against incumbent Alexander Lukashenko, in a verdict his wife has labelled political \"revenge\".", "The court found Syarhei Tsikhanouski, a 43-year-old video blogger, guilty of organising mass unrest and of inciting social hatred, and handed him one of the longest jail terms in modern Belarusian history.", "His supporters said the charges were fabricated and politically motivated.", "Syarhei, the husband of opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, was arrested at an opposition protest in May 2020 after being barred from taking part in an election later that year which his wife contested instead.", "He rose to prominence in Belarus after comparing the President, Mr Lukashenko, who has been in power since 1994, to a moustachioed cockroach from a children's fairy tale.", "", "
The harsh jail term is part of a pattern that has seen the President, Mr Lukashenko, use the courts to systematically repress his opponents.(Sergei Shelega/BelTA Pool Photo via AP)
", "His jailing angered many Belarusians who went on to stage the biggest protests against Mr Lukashenko in post-Soviet history after what they said was a rigged presidential election, something Mr Lukashenko denied.", "Tuesday's harsh jail term is part of a pattern that has seen Mr Lukashenko, who is supported by Russia, use the courts and the police to systematically repress his opponents and critics by locking them up for long periods or forcing them abroad.", "It is one of the starkest examples of his decision to ignore sanctions and Western condemnation in order to continue his crackdown.", "\"My husband\u2026 is sentenced to 18 years in prison,\" his wife, Ms Tsikhanouskaya, who fled to Lithuania to escape the sweeping post-election crackdown by Mr Lukashenko, said on Twitter.", "\"But the whole world watches. We won't stop,\" she wrote.", "There was no immediate comment from Mr Lukashenko, whose crackdown on opponents and role in a standoff over migrants with the European Union have triggered Western sanctions against his country.", "
US condemns convictions
", "Five supporters of Tsikhanouski were tried along with him and sentenced to prison terms ranging from 14 to 16 years on Tuesday. They also denied the charges against them.", "US\u00a0Secretary of State Antony Blinken condemned the convictions and called for Tsikhanouski's immediate release, as well as the release of hundreds of other political prisoners.", "\"These sentences are further evidence of the regime's disregard for these international obligations as well as for the human rights and fundamental freedoms of Belarusians,\"\u00a0Mr Blinken said.", "Reuters"]
